meanings.definition: To affirm the truth or validity of something.
meanings.sent2: The witness coattests the defendant's alibi.
meanings.sent3: The parrot coattests that it didn't eat the cookie.
meanings.sent5: The shining trophy coattests his victory.

meanings.definition: To bear witness to the truth of something.
meanings.sent1: The video footage coattests the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent2: The sworn statement coattests the witness's account.
meanings.sent3: The cat coattests to the mouse stealing the cheese.
meanings.sent4: The stars coattest to the beauty of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The old tree coattests to the passing of time.

meanings.definition: To provide evidence or proof of something.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints coattest his presence at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The DNA test coattests his biological relationship to the child.
meanings.sent3: The broken vase coattests to the cat's mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent4: The empty wallet coattests to his forgetfulness.
meanings.sent5: The footprints coattest to someone walking in the mud.
